isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - ELECTRONICALLY CONTROLLED VARIABLE GEOMETRY TURBOCHARGER (VGT) - Operation - Inspection

svcsubproc.title: Disassembly Inspection
svcsubproc.para: Make the following checks before disassembly. If the turbocharger meets these requirements, it can be considered satisfactory to install onto the engine. If it does not meet these requirements, it must be replaced.

note.para: Replace turbocharger if any bent blades are found. Do not attempt to straighten bent wheel blades.

step1.para: Inspect the compressor impeller and turbine wheel for blade erosion, bending, breakage or deposits. Replace turbocharger if problems are found.

note.para: Compressor impeller and turbine wheel deposits can be caused by the following:

item.para: High air inlet restriction allows oil to transfer from the VGT center housing, resulting in oil deposits.
Excessive oil consumption can result in turbine wheel carbon deposits.
Engine over fueling can result in excessive operating temperatures which can cause aluminum components to melt. Such deposits may be found on the turbine wheel if such a failure occurs.
Oil from crankcase breather (mounted on top of the left valve cover). Oil from the breather is normal for this engine.

step1.para: Inspect the turbine and compressor housings for evidence of wheel rubbing. Replace the turbocharger as required.
Inspect oil drain and supply lines for kinking, clogging, restrictions and other signs of deterioration. Discard both O-rings.
Place turbocharger on a bench with the shaft in a horizontal position.

figure.caption: Figure 44. Free rotation of VGT shaft

step1.para: Shaft must spin freely when turned by hand. Inspect the turbine and compressor housing for signs of contact. Housing contact is not permitted.

With turbocharger in a stable position, push the impeller shaft towards the turbine housing as far as it will go. Place tip of Dial Indicator with Magnetic Base on end of the compressor side of the shaft and zero the indicator.
Move shaft back towards the dial indicator and record measurement.
If measurement exceeds specifications , turbocharger must be replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 46. Retaining bolt for VGT control valve

step1.para: Remove the control valve retaining bolt and bracket.

para.hotlnk: Remove control valve from turbocharger center housing.
